text: Pyramid Mountain is a 2,395-foot (730-meter) elevation mountain summit located on Kodiak Island in the US state of Alaska. The mountain is situated west of Kodiak. Although modest in elevation, relief is significant since the peak rises over 2,300 feet above Buskin Lake in only . This peak's descriptive name was first published in 1943 by the United States Coast and Geodetic Survey.Donald J. Orth, Dictionary of Alaska Place Names, 1967, page 784. Based on the Köppen climate classification, Pyramid Mountain is located in a subpolar oceanic climate zone with cold winters and cool summers. Summer months offer the most favorable weather for climbing the peak via an established two-mile trail. ==See also== *List of mountain peaks of Alaska *Geography of Alaska ==References== ==External links== * Weather forecast: Pyramid Mountain Category:Mountains of Alaska Category:Mountains of Kodiak Island Borough, Alaska
title: Pyramid Mountain (Kodiak Island)
